wikipedia_page.main: John "Johnny" Condon (28 February 1889 – 21 February 1919) was a British bantamweight professional boxer who competed in the early twentieth century. He died a week prior to his 30th birthday of influenza.Condon won a silver medal in Boxing at the 1908 Summer Olympics and was also the 1909 ABA Bantamweight champion.

Albert Henry "Harry" Thomas (1 July 1888 – 13 January 1963) was a British bantamweight professional boxer who won gold in Boxing at the 1908 Summer Olympics with a decision over John Condon.
* Final: defeated John Condon (Great Britain) by decision (won gold medal)

William "Wally" Webb (born 19 November 1882, date of death unknown) was a British bantamweight boxer who competed in the early twentieth century. He won a bronze medal in boxing at the 1908 Summer Olympics losing against John Condon in the semi-finals.
* John Condon (boxer) (1889–1919), British bantamweight professional boxer
* John Condon (British Army soldier) (1896–1915), previously thought to be the youngest British soldier killed in the First World War
